No confidence: Iwi reps lose confidence in Taranaki council after Treaty bill debate blocked https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/no-confidence-iwi-reps-lose-confidence-in-taranaki-council-after-treaty-bill-debate-blocked/PYZOYDAH7REQ7EZR3GAVX6RCDU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/no-confidence-iwi-reps-lose-confidence-in-taranaki-council-after-treaty-bill-debate-blocked/PYZOYDAH7REQ7EZR3GAVX6RCDU/ Craig AshworthCouncillors' block on Treaty bill debate sparks iwi backlash in Taranaki. Wed, 08 Jan 2025 18:01:11 +0000 TRC's deputy chair Neil Walker suddenly decided the council wasn't a political body when the Government's Treaty bill was raised, and forced a vote to quash talk on the submission, which was ordered from staff by chair Charlotte Littlewood. Photo / Supplied, TRC

Puketi Forest Kauri Challenge on again in Far Northhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/puketi-forest-kauri-challenge-on-again-in-far-north/UMVFYGC44JB43NN5CHD6FFUJXQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/puketi-forest-kauri-challenge-on-again-in-far-north/UMVFYGC44JB43NN5CHD6FFUJXQ/ The annual tramp in the Far North is not for beginners. Wed, 08 Jan 2025 17:00:01 +0000 The popular Puketi Forest Kauri Challenge is back on January 25, but it’s not for beginners
Northland’s multi-million dollar horticulture industry at low risk from Oriental fruit fly https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northlands-multi-million-dollar-horticulture-industry-at-low-risk-from-oriental-fruit-fly/VE7D4N2GHVEXRAOBUHECQMUSUY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northlands-multi-million-dollar-horticulture-industry-at-low-risk-from-oriental-fruit-fly/VE7D4N2GHVEXRAOBUHECQMUSUY/ Mike DinsdaleThe main horticulture areas are around Kerikeri and Maungatapere.Wed, 08 Jan 2025 17:00:01 +0000 A single male fruit fly found in the Hatea Drive area of Whangārei sparked a major biosecurity operation in 2014. A network of surveillance traps across the region are being checked by biosecurity officials after a fruit fly was found in Auckland
Plans for improved resilience of Northland electricity network announcedhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/plan-for-northland-electricity-networks-improved-resilience/GX3RQJEODJBVDMLTINUJKA3HTM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/plan-for-northland-electricity-networks-improved-resilience/GX3RQJEODJBVDMLTINUJKA3HTM/ Mike DinsdalePlans to boost Northland's power network after pylon collapse. Wed, 08 Jan 2025 17:00:01 +0000 The transmission pylon which fell last June at Glorit, north of Auckland, caused major disruption to Northland’s electricity network. Now, Top Energy, Transpower and Northpower are collaborating to boost the network’s resilience.
